text.p: These are the leading stories in Zimbabwe's state-owned Herald newspaper on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The daughter of Zimbabwe's Education minister Edmund Garwe was responsible for the leakage of a junior certificate examination paper at Harare's Dominican Convent High School.
- Countries in the catchment of the port of Beira have unanimously agreed to the rehabilitation and extension of the Beira Corridor into a development corridor.

- The Zimbabwe government has reaffirmed it will only reinstate junior doctors and nurses who were dismissed after going on strike to press for better salaries on condition that they are not paid for the period they were not at work.
